DOC.brief_title: 0.005 % Sodium Hypochlorite Final Rinse Solution Atopic Dermatitis
DOC.detailed_description: Objective : To determine safety efficacy 0.005 % sodium hypochlorite final rinse solution reduction Staphylococcus aureus colonization among child adult Filipinos mild moderate atopic dermatitis . Design : Randomized , double blind , control clinical trial . Setting : Makati Medical Center , Dermatology Outpatient Department Participants : Patients mild moderate atopic dermatitis , see Makati Medical Center Dermatology Outpatient Department . Sample size : 68 ( 34 treatment group , 34 placebo group ) Intervention : Eligible patient randomly allocate two group . The subject either treatment group ( 0.005 % sodium hypochlorite ) placebo group ( bath water ) . Subjects use liter 0.005 % sodium hypochlorite final rinse solution bath treatment group liter bath water placebo group . This intervention do twice week 12 week . Both patient assessor blind treatment assignment . Assessment Outcome : The outcome assess week 4 12 . Primary outcome measure use culture finding , physician 's global assessment ( PGA ) severity disease eczema area severity index ( EASI ) score . Secondary outcome measure assess adverse effect follow-up week 4 12 . Data Analysis : Kruskal-Wallis Test use compare significant difference score two group Wilcoxon Signed Rank Test use compare significant difference score within group .
